title: Ticket #5524: Handle missing protocols more gracefully.
description:
It turns out that some machines have specifically disabled IPv6, and therefore have no IPv6 address(es) at all. This causes us a grief, because ENABLE_IPV6 is now TRUE by default; we therefore try and fail to listen on the same IPv4 and IPv6 port.

Therefore make ENABLE_IPV[4|6] tri-state: TRUE (required to be present), FALSE (required to be not present), and IF_AVAILABLE (may be present or not) and enforce the tri-state.

IF_AVAILABLE implies the ability to decide if we should be binding on/using both protocols or not.
